climbs.name: Illusion Traverse - North To South
climbs.fa: Dick Culbert, R. Hatch, Monty Laserre, Arnold Shives, September 16 1962

content.description:
The Illusion Traverse may be done either south to north or north to south. This is the North to South description starting from the North Summit. If you have just reached the North Summit by doing the traverse from South to North, this is your fastest way home!

From the summit of North Illusion, scramble south along the ridge until forced to rappel to the au cheval. Horsey ride your way along the au cheval to its north end (giddy-up) and a webbing anchor. Make a 25 m rappel into the North-South notch. Now climb three pitches out of the north up the north ridge of South Illusion Peak. The first pitch is about 5.7. The second short pitch is typically the crux with a short bit of 5.9 climbing featuing small nuts and small cams. Gain a spacious belay ledge at a protruding finger of rock and climb a right-diagonalling long pitch of 5.6 to the South Illusion summit ridge. 

Dick Culbert asserted that you can also climb a bushy 4th class fault system slightly further south to bypass the first two pitches but it looks like a godawful thrash.

Note that in 1993, Kobus Barnard, John Black and Emily Butler started the Nesakwatch Enchainment by climbing Disillusion Peak, then this, then continuing south all the way to Rexford's south Peak and Pi Pillar.



Between North and South Illusion Peaks

Small rack to 3" including rappel webbing to beef up existing anchors.

climbs.name: South Ridge
climbs.fa: most likely by Tselxweyeqw goat hunters

content.description:
One of the best scrambles in the Rexford Group, and can be done easily either as a long day trip from cars or a short daytrip from a camp in the basin below Mount Rexford and South Nesakwatch Spire. 

Follow the Nesakwatch and Rexford trail to the alpine talus bowl below and northwest of North Nesakwatch Spire. Bushwack directly up through krummholz to the col at the base of North Nesakwatch Spire's north ridge. Now, go the other way. Head north along the divide, and scramble up to the top of the unnamed bump between North Nesakwatch and south Illusion. Descend into the notch to its north, and deal with a short section of very tight and troublesome waist-deep krummholz in the col. From here, circle to the right to outflank a steep wall, and climb slabs, short walls and snowpatches up the south ridge of South Illusion itself to gain the level summit ridge. Walk along beautiful granite slabs to the summit, overlooking the North illusion-South illusion col. Return the same way. 



Same as for Rexford and Nesakwatch Spires to the talus bowl NW of North Nesakwatch Spire

ice axe is useful when snow is present; typically not steep enough to warrant crampons
Highest summit of the Illusion Group. Has large walls and spurs on all sides but the south.
